data.description:
Emerging and developing countries, especially in remote locations, are most affected by environmental degradation and climate change. However, they often lack the resources to take meaningful action, making them entirely dependent on the decisions of other countries.

It is estimated that an annual investment of $5 trillion is needed to combat climate change. Of this figure, emerging and developing countries (EMDEs) need $2 trillion annually, a fivefold increase from 2020 (IMF, 2023).

Without the right infrastructure to coordinate such significant budgets, it's unlikely that EMDEs will be able to attract $2 trillion annually and take the required actions.

Local NGOs, businesses, and individuals in these EMDEs must be included in the solution to increase the socioeconomic support base for such action. Kolektivo allows local stakeholders to leverage their positive impact to start local impact-driven economies that regenerate communities and nature.

Kolektivo combines a web platform for stakeholders and a mobile app for individuals to create local impact economies based on the positive impact created.

By making the impact created more visible and streamlining the coordination of resources between stakeholders through our platform, we encourage local development. Due to the community currency created in our platform and the ability for users to earn skill badges, the pilot also supports capacity building and financial inclusion.

Impact partners and local businesses can support a local Kolektivo community and, in exchange, receive a visual claim on the impact created by a specific project or niche. The positive PR effects are more significant when supporting local ESG initiatives.

Our primary users are NGO managers who request community currency budgets from the local community to organize impact activities. Users earn community currencies, which they can spend at impact partners and skill points to participate in these activities.
data.title: GG20 - Climate Round

questions.explanation: Progress towards the deployment of the Kolektivo Climate Action platform in Q4 2024.

questions.explanation: We aim to make tangible progress with Climate action innovation leveraging Web3 primitives to create

questions.query: What is the long-term impact of your grant?
questions.explanation: Realizing Kolektivo's Climate Action platform will create a standard for onchain in personal activity organization and tracking .

questions.query: How will the grant funds be used?
questions.explanation: Primary on UX research, prototyping and development.

questions.query: What is the timeframe for the work funded?
questions.explanation: ~ 3 months.

questions.query: How will receiving a grant enable you to foster growth or innovation within the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: It allows us to dedicate more resources towards the development and testing of our solution.

data.title: Develop Partner Web Application
data.description: After completing our Web App design phase, we now have to build and test our Web App.

data.reason: We got caught up by some scope creep slowing down the development. However, it did ultimately lead into a better Web App and a lot of insights for our next iteration. We'll demo the Web App on the 15th of December, after which only minor updates should be required.

questions.query: Impact statement - what real world problem do you solve and how
questions.explanation: Kolektivo Network contributes to scalable in person climate and impact initiatives. It aim to 10x the volunteer economy experience (US$1.348 trillion industry), both for contributors and donors.

questions.query: Celo leverage - how does your project contributed to the Celo ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Kolektivo leverages the Celo blockchain to issue community currencies, GeoHypercerts as Impact Certificates and EAS to attest activity data, user progress, and maintain network registries.

data.text: Our deliverables for this Round are the same as our GG21 - Climate Solutions round. Please visit that page to view our progress!
data.title: Verifying our progress in GG21 - Climate Solutions

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/Kolektivo

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: Yes, please find our Karma Gap profile here: https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/kolektivo-network

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Kolektivo builds OSS tools for capital allocation and impact coordination in local communities.

We innovate a lot with Hypercerts and location-based activities. As part of the Unicef Ventures Climate Cohort, we're implementing open-source best practices into our Mobile App code, allowing others to re-use our solutions.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Our current solution, which is nearing completion enables the following use-cases:
- Web App, allows local merchants and organization to register into a community and host impact activities.
- Mobile App, allows local community members to earn stablecoins by participating in impact activities, earn skill badges and spend stablecoins at local merchants through a map interface.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We aim to finalize the development of our next Climate Action platform (Web + Mobile App) by November this year. After that, we'll gradually roll out the solution in Trinindad and Curacao, our main pilot locations. In 2025, we aim to create a roadmap for the full, token powered version of Kolektivo Network.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Our contract, Web App, and Mobile App are all open-source. We continue to build on top of and nurture open-source code and onchain protocols.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: Our solution allows for the organization of local (impact) activities which can be paid out in local (community) stablecoins accepted in these communities creating a circular economy of onchain impact and payments.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
Our next step is building a local stablecoin in collaboration with Mento and integrating in local fintech solutions to provide a more seamless on-the-ground experience for activity hosts, contributors, impact buyers and merchants. 

This GG23 grant will provide us with resources to progress CGC development
